of alternatives.

child_c2e1a03f5de84be1bace60527dcf0630.content:
Research problem refers to some difficulty which a researcher experiences in the context of either 
a Theoretical or Practical situation or wants to obtain solution for the same.

child_8bf9000c3c974ed5b40591919705dbb0.content:
The components of research problem are 
1) There must be an individual or group which has some difficulty or the problem 
2) There must be some objective(s) to be attained at.
child_8bf9000c3c974ed5b40591919705dbb0.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_23d50e57f0d949d5b4c4e242d5c7f45a.content:
3) There must be alternative means or (Course of action) for obtaining the Objective(s) 
one wishes to attain.
child_23d50e57f0d949d5b4c4e242d5c7f45a.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_66ba98ae2552483a89dc80bb26e26a7b.content: 4) There must remain some doubt in the mind of a researcher with regard to t
child_66ba98ae2552483a89dc80bb26e26a7b.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_9a13b957e7254c79a279c88b9d122b4f.content:
4) There must remain some doubt in the mind of a researcher with regard to the selection 
of alternatives.
child_9a13b957e7254c79a279c88b9d122b4f.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_45cf23189dde4cc7a5eca8161b7906ec.content: 5) There must be some environment(s) to which the difficulty pertains.
child_45cf23189dde4cc7a5eca8161b7906ec.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

given problem i.e., to find out which course of action the objective can be attained optimally in 
the context of a given environment.

RESEARCH METHODOLOGY AND IPR (SHS04) 
Unit-II 
SURVEY OF LITERATURE 
 
After defining a research problem, the researcher has to do literature survey connected with the 
problem.

child_2ad6ade8d3a644a294a770ce83d6be7e.content:
It is a collection of research publications, books and other documents related to the defined 
problem.

problem and other related details one can survey

child_51046ed934b9486db33c19ac66c390b2.content:

child_a3ef1846f43b4eea950b773f15240d43.content:
Respect the persons:-  
• Informed consent: - Researches must enure that participants voluntarily agree to participate in the 
study with a full understanding of its purpose procedure, risks and benefits.
child_a3ef1846f43b4eea950b773f15240d43.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_bdaf22d9452e41b6a9eda0a8fbfd5cfa.content:
• Autonomy:- participants should have the right to make their own decisions about participating in 
research.
child_bdaf22d9452e41b6a9eda0a8fbfd5cfa.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_71c632a688024022901b0607098db19c.content:
Beneficence:-  
• Maximizing benefits, minimizing harm: -Researches should ensure that it potential benefits of its 
research outweigh the risk or harm to participants.
child_71c632a688024022901b0607098db19c.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_0c92f4eac98c423c918bddc84c52641e.content:
Justice:- 
• Fair treatment: - The benefits and burdens of research should be distributed fairly among all 
groups.
child_0c92f4eac98c423c918bddc84c52641e.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_a32087a197a24909a07fe342347e6668.content:
• Equitable selection of participants: - Researcher’s must ensure that participant recruitment is done 
fairly and withot bias.
child_a32087a197a24909a07fe342347e6668.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_95c1fd0715a84d5397cfe6e0635ee083.content:
re that participant recruitment is done 
fairly and withot bias.

child_2106f88db5924e59990b7bffb328853c.content: Confidentiality:- The researcher must ensure that the participants data is handled confidentially.
child_2106f88db5924e59990b7bffb328853c.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_b1e71696f07f46cbb8f25006b64b995a.content:
Integrity and transparency: -Researcher’s must avoid fabrication, plagiarism, or any form of 
misconduct.
child_b1e71696f07f46cbb8f25006b64b995a.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_765f6523401a45ddbf11542491b591da.content:
All aspects of the research process from methodology to reporting should be clear and

child_765f6523401a45ddbf11542491b591da.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_efae7bc11b414ffca8ef766099c2a19b.content: Social responsibility:- Researcher’s should ensure that their work contribute positively to society.
